page.text: It was a bad idea from the start. Even though you were penniless and starving after the money won during your last adventure ran out, you should have known better than to try stealing from the stall of a fat merchant. Fat merchants get that way by making very, very sure that no one else steals from them.

Now you stand silently in the courtroom in Wolftown, awaiting the magistrate’s verdict. Suddenly the brooding silence is broken as a thin, robed man with a short, tangles beard rises to his feet in the public gallery.
‘The court recognises that Guild of Magicians’, the magistrate says uneasily.

‘May it please the court,’ the wizard says in a surprisingly powerful voice, ‘the Guilds- requests the life and person of this prisoner.’ Your heart sinks. Just when you thought things couldn’t get any worse! No one knows what happens to prisoners who are claimed but the Wizards’ Guild, but you can guess. Perhaps the will grind your liver up for one their potions, or sell your soul to a Demon. The prospect of a lifetime in jail suddenly doesn’t seem so bad. ‘request granted’, the magistrates intones. ‘The prisoner is to be conveyed to the Wizards’ Guild under escort.’ A murmur runs through the court as the guards lead you out…

‘Well, you might at least look a little more cheerful,’ the wizard says as you arrive as the Guildhouse. ‘I offer you a chance to live.’ He chuckles at the look of suspicion you throw at him. ‘Let me explain. Just over a decade ago, there was a sorcerer, a member of this Guild, named Galthazzeth. His interest lay in creating magical cross-breeds, but he went too far and was expelled. Now we have discovered that he has occupied an abandoned mine at the edges of the mountains, where he is breeding an army of his abominations.

It is clear that he threatens to wreak revenge upon ass of us.’ The wizard looks grim. ‘His lair is well guarded, especially against sorcerers. But you , you are an adventurer. Your life is already forfeit, so you have nothing to lose - and we offer you a chance to regain life and your freedom. Will you accept this mission?’

You make up your mind. ‘You give me little choice. Where do I find this Galthazzeth?’ ‘You will be given a map and all that we have found out about the lair,’ the wizard smiles, ‘once you have equipped yourself. Come!’

Now you are fully equipped and ready for what leis ahead. The wizard walks with you to the gates of Wolftown. He points to the foothills of the mountains, several days’ walk away, and wishes you good fortune. You settle your pack more comfortably on your back, set your face in a firm expression, and start walking.

Following the directions you were given by the Wizards Guild, you trek for many days, first through scrubland and the thick forest, until you draw close to the clearing where the entrance to Galthazzeth’s underground lair can be found. A cliff face rises sheer above the forest to a height of over 60 metres to the first of the plateaux fringing the mountains. From the edge of the clearing you peer cautiously out at the dark entrance to the mine.
Test your Luck. If you are Lucky, turn to 195. If your are unlucky, turn to 69.

You walk cautiously up to the statue. As you approach, you see that its eyes are made of two large rubies which sparkle in the half-light. If you want the gems turn to 101. To examine the racks of implements, turn to 57. To examine the brazier, turn to 154.

You manage to loosen one stone, when suddenly you are struck from behind by a jet of flame. Deduct 2 points from your STAMINA. You spin around and see that the brazier has just ignited itself! To carry on prising the stone free, turn to 109. To stop and examine the brazier, turn to 48.

You have no option but to fight Galthazzeth.
GALTHAZZETH SKILL 10 STAMINA 15
If he wins two consecutive rounds of combat, turn to 28. If you win, turn to 174.

Finally the Scitalis dies. Looking round the room, you see that not all the treasure was an illusion - among the bones of past victims you find a jewelled sword and two gems that are worth 25 Gold Pieces each. The sword is magical; in combat it will add 1 point to your Attack Strength.
Now return along the passage to 42 and choose another route.

From your hiding place you can hear Galthazzeth shouting orders in an unknown language. Even though the spell failed, your attempt to cast it has given you away. You grip your sword and stand up; the Ant men and Zombies close in on you. Roll two dice. If the total rolled is 5 or less, turn to 179. If you roll 6 or more, turn to 39.

Galthazzeth hobbles through the doorway into a small cave furnished with more workbenches, arranged round a large stone tank. As you enter, a blue-green spark leaps to the tank and the stuff in it stirs. The mage limps out of the chamber. Before you can follow, the substance in the tank rises up in a column and shoots out a tentacle at you.
CLONE SLIME SKILL 4 STAMINA 30
Fight three rounds then turn to 197.

This seems to be some kind of store room: it is littered with all kinds of debris, but it is not occupied. To search the debris, turn to 21. To shut the door and continue east round the corner, turn to 42. To shut the door and go back west, turn to 170.
You shout a war-cry and lunge at the spectral figure. Do you have a magical weapon? If you have, turn to 27. Otherwise, turn to 133.

The last few Antrnen SCl.lttle away from your sword, chittering in agitation. You and Galthc1zzeth are left facing each other across the wreckage. The sorcerer fclises one hand to cast a spell. If you have a spear or dagger, turn to 148. Otherwise, turn to 187.
You decide to leave the artifact alone and exit the room. Return to 8 and make another choice
You head south along the passage. After a few paces, you notice a door in the east wall. Further south is a crossroads. To open the door, turn to 75. To continue as far as the junction, turn to 112.

Your weapon hits Galthazzeth before he can finish casting his spell, and a bolt of blue energy spirals harmlessly to the floor. You draw your sword and leap at him! Turn to 4, deducting 2 points from Galthazzeth's STAMINA.

The tunnel continues into the darkness. After several metres you rome to a door, set in the east wall. To open the door, turn to 75.
To continue up the corridor, turn to 198. To return to the crossroads and try another direction, turn to 112.
The stairs lead down to a short passage, ending at a wooden door.
You open it to find yourself in a room - inhabited by two surprised Antmen!

You close with the first before he can use his acid spray. Fight them one at a time.
First ANTMAN SKILL 6 STAMINA 8 Second ANTMAN SKILL 6 STAMINA 7
If you win, turn to 182.

At last the Goblin Shaman dies. A swift search of the body yields a few items of interest: 7 Gold Pieces, a small leather flask and a scroll. The flask holds a fizzing blue liquid which smells vaguely of fish. There is enough for two draughts; you may drink some at any time by making a note of the paragraph you are on, then turning to 172. To your surprise the scroll is in Allansian and seems to be a spell called 'Firestorm'. Now, to leave by the north door, turn to 20. To return to the crossroads and choose another direction, turn to 112.

As you dodge away from the animated whip, a door flies open. Into the room st rides a huge, ugly Goblin wearing shabby ceremonial robes. This must be the Shaman who serves the temple as a priest. He barks a few words in what you assume is the Goblin tongue, and the whip strikes again!
WHIP SKILL 9 STAMINA - Resolve this round, then turn to 145.
The wizard skips away from your sword and makes a gesture with one hand. Do you have an amethyst amulet? If you have, turn to 90. Otherwise, turn to 129.

The door swings open to reveal a room strewn with rubbish and crude furniture. Three Goblins are in the room; one snatches up a sword and d1arges at you, while the others leap up to get their own weapons. If you stay in the doorway, turn to 85. To advance into the room, turn to 93

You go through the north door into a large room. It seems to be some kind of temple; a statue of a vicious, powerful-looking Goblin, about two metres tall, stands at the far end; in front of it is an unlit iron brazier. On either side are racks of whips and knives. There is another door in the south wall. If you have a 'Firestorm' scroll, turn to 84. Otherwise, turn to 2
Test your Luck. If you are Lucky, turn to 33. If you are Unlucky, turn to 51

You carry on down the tunnel. Galthazzeth was heading for something important, maybe a way out - and you want to know what it is. After some distance you come to a complex maze of caves and passages. Turn to 110.

The amethyst glows a bright purple and the treasure fades away, revealing a large, brightly coloured snake in its place. You have heard of The Scitalis, or Treasure Snake, which uses illusions to attract its victims! The snake lies perfectly still, waiting to ambush adventurers, and doesn't appear to have noticed you. To attack it, turn to 122. If you would rather leave, return to 42 and choose another route.
You find nothing of interest among the debris. Leave here, return to 42 and choose another route.
You have surprised the Antman and manage to close with it before it can use its acid spray.
ANTMAN SKILL 7 STAMINA 7
If you win, turn to 62.

The Giant Beetle is busy eating and doesn't seem to take any notice as you approach it warily. Roll 2 dice. If the total rolled is less than or equal to your SKILL score, you have wounded it and may deduct 2 points from its STAMINA. Otherwise, your sword skids harmlessly off its tough carapace. Now fight it.
GIANT BEETLE SKILL 9 STAMINA 16
If you win, turn to 61.
You lash out at the Ghost with your magic sword. Resolve one round of combat.
GHOST SKILL 9 STAMINA 8
If you win this round, turn to 67. If the Ghost wins, turn to 126.
Roll one die. On 1 or 2, turn to 81. On 3 or 4, turn to 113. On 5 or 6, turn to 18.
You wait for a few seconds, then move quietly behind another bench. Test your Luck. If you are Lucky, turn to 184. If you are Unlucky, turn to 152.
No more slime emerges - you have defeated the Clone Slime!
Taking a lantern from one of the benches, you set the tank ablaze for good measure. Now to deal with that sorcerer! You run down the tunnel after Galthazzeth; turn to 167.

The wizard sees you the instant before you throw your weapon, and he makes a magical pass with his hands. The air before you becomes solid, like ice, and your weapon bounces harmlessly off. Turn to 105.

You ram the door with your shoulder. It doesn't open, but one of its slats bounces back and hits you! Deduct 2 points from your STAMINA. The door is an Imitator, able to take any form it chooses. It flows into a roughly humanoid shape and attacks you.
IMITATOR SKILL 9 STAMINA 8
If you win, turn to 121.
Lying among the rubbish you find a beautiful gold amulet set with an amethyst. If you want to take it, turn to 131. If you would rather leave it, turn to 11.

'Pah' spits the Ghost. 'Just because I'm dead doesn't mean I'm stupid! Do you really expect me to believe that?' What will you do now; attack the Ghost (turn to 9), run away (turn to 170) or return to 147 and choose another story?
The staircase leads up to a small, empty chamber. There is a door in the north wall, and a passage enters to the east. To go along the passage, turn to 99; to open the door, turn to 168.

As you round the corner, you espy someone crouching in front of a door, a few metres ahead. He seems to be picking the lock- and he hasn't heard you corning. To speak to him, turn to 132. To attack him, turn to 143. To keep quiet and watch, turn to 124.

The whip drops to the floor as the Shaman dies. A swift search of its body yields 7 Gold Pieces, a small leather flask and a scroll. The flask holds a fizzing blue liquid which smells vaguely of fish. There is enough for two draughts; you may drink some at any time by making a note of where you are, then turning to 172.
The scroll is written in Allansian and seems to be a spell called 'Firestorm '.

As the smoke and dust clear, you can see that the spell has worked! Everywhere there are dead and injured and wrecked equipment. You climb shakily to your feet; reduce your STAMINA by 2 points, but regain 1 LUCK point. Galthazzeth clambers from behind the ruins of a workbench, glowering with rage. He raises one hand to cast a spell. If you have a spear or dagger, turn to 148. Otherwise, turn to 187.

You twist to one side, and the bolt of fire just misses you. You can smell your armour scorching as the missile grazes your shoulder, but you are unharmed. You leap at the Shaman before he can cast another spell.
GOBLIN SHAMAN SKILL 6 STAMINA 6 If he wins two consecutive rounds, turn to 88. If you win, turn to 16.
Among the debris are the remains of several bodies. You manage to find a total of 20 Gold Pieces. Now you must leave the room, return to 42 and choose another route

You walk to the comer then turn northwards. After a few metres, you find a passage leading to the east; the main passage ends at a door, a few steps further on. To head east, turn to 165. To continue north, turn to 52. Or you can return to 103 and choose another way.

The creature leaps at you. GOBLIN SKILL 6 STAMINA 6 If you win, you can look around. A quick search turns up a spear, a dagger and a bronze medallion marked with a G-rune. However, you also find to your horror that the snack the Goblin was eating was part of a human arm! Now you may enter the mine; turn to 112.

Shaking with the mental effort, you try to follow the words on the scroll. A strange power begins to well up inside you, but you trip over the complicated words and symbols - after all, you were not trained as a wizard. The power turns inwards and explodes inside your brain; you have lost the spell. Roll one die and lose that many STAMINA points. If you are still alive, turn to 6.
You are not quick enough to avoid the energy bolt. Roll one die and lose that many STAMINA points. If you are still alive, turn to 4 and continue the battle.

You just manage to dodge the mandibles of an immense Giant Beetle! It may have missed you this time, but it's certainly going to have another try.
GIANT BEETLE SKILL 9 STAMINA 16
If you defeat the monster, turn to 61
The door opens into a passage heading south-west. To go down the passage, turn to 108. To continue northwards, turn to 83
You look closely at the brazier, but you can't see anything unusual. If you want to carry on prising the gems free, tum to 109. Otherwise you may leave here; return to 112 and choose another way.
You burst through the door into a small room that is occupied by two Goblins. They move to attack you with shrill cries.
First GOBLIN SKILL 5 STAMINA 6 Second GOBLIN SKILL 5 STAMINA 5

Each makes a separate attack on you every round, but you must choose which of the two you will attack. Fight your chosen opponent as normal. Throw again for your fight with the second Goblin: if you win, the Goblin is not wounded, but you have held him off for a round; if you lose, he injures you in the usual way! If you defeat both Goblins, turn to 118.

You hit the icy water with a shock and start to swim for the other side. You have swum scarcely a couple of strokes when something rises from the water in front of you: a massive cross-bred monster with a human face, an octopus body and two tentacles, each of which grips a weapon. You must fight, with your Attack Strength reduced by 2 points because you have to tread water.
MAN-OCTOPUS SKILL 6 STAMINA 7
If you win, you reach the other side safely and can follow Galthazzeth down the tunnel; turn to 114.
You find nothing of interest or value. Return to 8 and make another choice.
The passage continues for a short distance before ending at a door. To open the door, turn to 32. To listen at it before entering, turn to 63. Or you can return to 42

book.page:
You try the door warily. It isn't locked - the bandit must have picked it. As you push open the door, though, a huge pair of clattering mandibles shoots out at you! Roll two dice. If the total rolled is less than or equal to your SKILL, turn to 46. If it is higher, turn to 164.
<roll pageNum="46" value="<=skill">

page.text: This seems to be the trigger point for some kind of mechanism; although you fiddle with it for some time, you can't make it do anything. Now you may continue north (turn to 20) or eastwards, back to the crossroads (turn to 112).
You shout a war-cry and leap up spectacularly from your hiding-place! Test your Luck. If you are Lucky, turn to 86. If you are Unlucky, turn to 194.
The spell is too strong for you. Roll one die. If you roll 1--4, deduct 1 point from your SKILL; if you roll 5 or 6, lose 2 SKILL points! Turn to 4 to continue the battle.

You shudder as you gaze at the racks of whips and knives, your imagination filled with all manner of terrible images. Suddenly a whip leaps into the air and begins to strike at you!
WHIP SKILL 9 STAMINA­
Resolve one round of combat, then turn to 17
You look closely at the brazier and notice with a shudder that some of the ashes contain burnt bones! Test your Luck. If you are Lucky, turn to 157. If you are Unlucky, turn to 186.

You stretch your reflexes to the limit to beat the wizard to the first blow. As your sword strikes home, a bolt of blue energy boils harmlessly away into the air - he has lost the spell he was trying to cast.
Turn to 4, but deduct 2 points from Galthazzeth's STAMINA.

You leap on to the bridge and charge headlong towards the sorcerer. He croaks in fear and limps away down a tunnel on the other side. The ropes of the bridge creak and groan as you race across, but you make it safely to the other side. Turn to 114.

The monstrous Beetle finally collapses! You take a deep breath, clean the vile thing's green blood from your sword and quickly search I the room. Test your Luck. If you are Lucky, turn to 41. If you are Unlucky, turn to 24.
What will you do? To listen at the door, turn to 180. To open the door, turn to 106. To return and try the side-passage, turn to 198. Or you may return to the crossroads at 112 and try another route.

You put your ear to the door and listen - so you are taken completely by surprise when one of the planks bulges outwards and hits you! Deduct 2 points from your STAMINA. The 'door' lurches forward and flows into a roughly humanoid shape to attack you. It is an Imitator, a cunning shapechanging monster!
IMITATOR SKILL 9 STAMINA 8
If you win, turn to 121.
You can hear muffled shuffling and scrabbling noises. Return to 124 and choose another option.

The Goblins have small change worth 3 Gold Pieces between them. Each of them is also wearing an iron pendant in the shape of a double-headed axe, and one has a pair of bone dice. You may take any of these articles if you wish. Now you may search the room; turn to 181. Otherwise, will you leave through the north door (turn to 20) or return to the crossroads at 112 and choose another way?

attribute.description: iron pendant in the shape of a double-headed axe

page.text: You prop the body against the door and shove. The door swings open - but before the body can fall, it is seized by a Giant Beetle and dragged into the room! If you want to enter the room and attack the creature, turn to 26. Otherwise, return to 42 and pick another route.
The Ghost howls in pain as your magic sword wounds it. Reduce its STAMINA by 2 points. It screams at you to stop. If you desist, tum to 177. If you would rather press home your attack, turn to 192.

book.page:
You follow the map through a winding labyrinth of passages and small caverns. The maze is very complex and, despite the map, you find yourself at a dead end. You groan as you realize that you must have taken a wrong turning somewhere-and now you're lost! Test your Luck.
If you are Lucky, turn to 193. If you are Unlucky, return to the top of this paragraph. If your LUCK score is 2 or less, turn to 160.
<luckStat value="<=2" pageNum="160">

page.text: You enter the tunnel cautiously, but a shuffling noise behind you warns you that you have been spotted. You turn and see a Goblin armed with a spear charging at you; it must have been hiding outside when you entered. Turn to 43.

The passage opens out into a huge rocky chamber, littered with rubble, a broken wooden cart and other debris. However, a brief search fails to turn up anything of value. There is a door in the north wall. To leave through it, turn to 103; otherwise, return to the cross roads at 112 and choose again.
You press one of the Goblins' pendants into the hollow. The axe symbol glows briefly, then a section of the wall swings open! Regain 1 LUCK point. Turn to 125 .

book.page:
After some distance the passage widens and becomes a room. There is a door in the far wall, but it is guarded by an Antman warrior. Roll two dice. If the total is less than or equal to your SKILL, turn to 25. If it is higher, turn to 97.
<roll pageNum="25" value="<=skill">

page.text: A bolt of fire erupts from the Goblin's fingertips and streaks across the room at you! Test your Luck. If you are Lucky, turn to 40. If you are Unlucky, turn to 169.

book.page:
The maze is very complex, twisting and turning all over the place. Without a map you soon become hopelessly lost. Test your Luck. If you are Lucky, turn to 193. If you are Unlucky, return to the top of this paragraph. If your LUCK reaches 2 or less, turn to 160.
<luckStat pageNum="160" value="<=2">

page.text: Roll one die. On a 1 or 6, the door flies open with a crash; turn to 19. If you roll anything else, the door stays firmly shut and you bruise your shoulder; deduct 1 point from your STAMINA. You may try again by returning to the start of this paragraph. Otherwise, you may continue up the corridor (turn to 198) or return to the crossroads (turn to 112) and choose another way.

You realize that you are heavily out numbered, but if you can get close enough to Galthazzeth without being noticed, you may be able to kill him and escape in the resulting confusion. You duck behind a pile of crates, hardly daring to breath. After a few seconds, you launch yourself towards the bench in a crouching run. Test your Luck. If you are Lucky, turn to 29. If you are unlucky, turn to 152.
The door opens into a short passage, from which a spiral staircase leads upwards. To go up the stairs, turn to 35. Alternatively, return to 182 and choose another option.

This room is littered with gnawed bones, some of which seem to be human, and various other pieces of foul-smelling rubbish; but there is nothing of interest here. Return to 112 and choose another direction.

While you were fighting, two more disgusting Slime Figures have emerged from the tank. Reduce the Clone Slime's STAMINA by 10 points. You must fight both figures as a pair again.
First SLIME FIGURE SKILL 3 STAMINA 5 Second SLIME FIGURE SKILL 3 STAMINA 5
If you defeat them, turn to 175.
Finally the Ghost breaks down into mist and dissipates. You continue down the corridor; turn to 199.
A bolt of blue energy screams from the sorcerer's finger tips and you throw yourself to one side. Test your Luck. If you are Lucky, turn to 139. If you are Unlucky, turn to 45.

You hit one of the Galthazzeths and it vanishes - the real one must be somewhere else. The others strike at you; deduct 2 points from your stamina. If there is only one Galthazzeth left, turn to 4 and continue combat. If more than one is left, return to 129 and continue from there.

You follow the passage for a long way. After some time it begins to slope upwards. Finally it veers westwards but, as you turn the corner, you see a pale, glowing figure hovering in the passage. It begins to float towards you. To attack it, turn to 9. To stand perfectly still, turn to 147. Or you can run back to 170 and choose again.

As you approach the statue you see that its eyes are made of rubies, which glint invitingly in the half-light. To take the gems, turn to 3. To examine the brazier, turn to 58. Alternatively, you can return to the crossroads at 112.

The first Goblin attacks you.
GOBLIN SKILL 6 STAMINA 5
After the first round of combat, the other Goblins will have armed themselves but, since you are standing in the doorway, they will have to attack you one at a time.
Second GOBLIN SKILL 5 STAMINA 6 Third GOBLIN SKILL 5 STAMINA 5
If you defeat all three, turn to 155.
Galthazzeth's hand moves even more swiftly than your sword, and your blow glances off an invisible wall of force, leaving the sorcerer unharmed. Turn to 105.
'Liar!' the Ghost moans. 'The fiend employs no human servants!' What do you do now? To try another story, return to 147. To attack the Ghost, turn to 9. To run away, turn to 170.

The Goblin Shaman dodges away from your sword for a few seconds - long enough to cast a spell. A bolt of fire streaks towards you. Test your Luck. If you are Lucky, turn to 40. If you are Unlucky, turn to 169.
You look carefully at the brazier but can see nothing unusual. If you want to prise the gems from the statue, turn to 109. Alternatively, return to the crossroads at 112 and choose another route.

For a brief instant, you can see four identical Galthazzeths standing before you! Then your amulet glows purple. As the light fades, so three of the wizards vanish, leaving only the real one. Return to 4, but note that Galthazzeth will not use this spell again.

The door opens on to a large, rocky chamber littered with rubble, a broken cart and other debris. A brief search doesn't turn up anything valuable. A passage leads off westwards; to follow it, turn to 112.
Alternatively, you may return through the north door and head east (turn to 42) or west (turn to 170) or try the door on the other side (turn to 8).
Hate makes your throw go astray, and you can only dodge to one side as a bolt of blue energy screams towards you. Test your Luck. If you are Lucky , turn to 139. If you are Unlucky, turn to 45.

One Goblin engages you in battle while the others arm themselves.
First GOBLIN SKILL 5 STAMINA 5
After one round, the others will attack you too!
Second GOBLIN SKILL 5 STAMINA 5 Third GOBLIN SKILL 5 STAMINA 4
Roll one Attack Strength for yourself and one for each Goblin. Each Goblin who scores higher than you will wound you. You may roll higher, but you can injure only one of the Goblins in any one round. If you win, turn to 155.

book.page:
You try to retrace your route. Roll 2 dice. If the total is less than or equal to your SKILL, turn to 200. Otherwise, turn to 153.
<roll value="<=skill" pageNum="200">

page.text: You search the room thoroughly, but find nothing beyond a great deal of dust and insects. You may leave either via the door in the north wall (turn to 20) or by returning east (turn to 112).

The chest contains 12 Gold Pieces, a filthy and foul-smelling package, and a vial with a potion in it. This is a Potion of Fortune, with enough for two doses. If you want to open the package, turn to 176. Otherwise, return to 155.

The Antman has seen you; it whips its abdomen around and fires a spray of acid at you. Roll your Attack Strengths as usual: if you win, you have avoided the spray; if you lose, Test your Luck. If you are Lucky , the spray has not hit your eyes; deduct 1 point from your STAMINA. If you are Unlucky, you are blinded for a moment; deduct 2 points from your SKILL and 2 from your STAMINA. Now you may close with the Antman and fight as normal.
ANTMAN SKILL 5 STAMINA 8
If you win, turn to 62.

book.page:
You jump up from your hiding-place and throw your weapon at Galthazzeth. Roll two dice. If the total is less than or equal to your SKILL, turn to 31. Otherwise, turn to 116.
<roll value="<=skill" pageNum="31">

page.text: The passage leads east for some way before turning south. After a few metres, you see a door set in the west wall; the passage continues for some way, before turning east. To follow the passage, turn to 183. To open the door, turn to 47. Alternatively, you may retrace your steps; turn to 83.
You hear nothing. Return to 182 and choose another option.
You try to prise out the rubies. Roll one die. If you roll 1-3, turn to 137. If you roll 4-6, turn to 189.
